newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late palm olein lower, buyers cautious.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late palm olein lower, buyers cautious.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were lower in late Tuesday trading in line with Malaysian values as buyers stayed cautious expecting further falls, traders said.
They said palm olein was around 1,440-50 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, compared with the morning's 1,455-60 rupiah. Some quotes were heard at 1,435 rupiah.
Traders said market talk that 5,000 tonnes of imported olein was headed for Surabaya pushed buyers to the sidelines.
The cargo was said to be the last of a 20,000-tonne consignment ordered by state logistics agency BULOG from Malaysia to cool local prices.
"The 5,000-tonne shipment would complete BULOG's 20,000-tonne order from Malaysia," one trader said. "There has been no news on whether BULOG has made fresh orders."
Traders said supply of prompt-delivery olein was expected to pick up through the week with the arrival of several shipments, including one with 6,000 tonnes from Belawan Port.
"I think prices are likely to be depressed in the near term because of BULOG," one trader said, adding that sharp falls in Malaysia on Tuesday also impacted the local market.
